snippet.title: Police and Army units sent to deal with post-election unrest in Enga Province
snippet.content: Violence has broken out in Enga province after the seat of Kandep was declared for the PNC candidate Alfred Manase. After the election result was announced, supporters of the losing candidate, Opposition Leader Don Polye reportedly became violent. Enga Provincial Police Commander George Kakas tells Bruce Hill he is sending police and army units into the area, and is hoping the situation doesn't escalate.

sindex.name: Enga Provincial Police Commander George Kakas
